settings.title: 2025 Swoveralls Design Contest
settings.subtitle: You design. We make. Everyone gets comfy.
settings.intro_text:
How It Works

1. Submit Your Design
Create a print design for Swoveralls. Patterns, illustrations, graphics, whatever you want. Submit by end of day December 7th.

2. Vote for Your Favorites
We'll publish all eligible designs on December 8th. You pick your top 2 favorites. Voting closes December 14th.

3. Two Designs Become Real
The top two vote-getters become limited edition Swoveralls collections in 2026.

What You Win

üé® Your design becomes an actual product

‚úçÔ∏è You name the print

üì£ Your name on the product description, website, emails, and social media

üëñ Free pairs of your winning design

üñºÔ∏è A framed print of your art

üèÜ Bragging rights for life
settings.timeline_1_desc: Submit your design entries through the form below üëá
settings.timeline_2_desc: We let democracy do it's thing
settings.timeline_4_desc: The two winners designs come to life
settings.faq_1_answer: This contest is open to anyone and everyone. No purchase necessary.
settings.faq_2_answer: Designs should be original pattern artwork suitable for apparel. We accept PNG, JPG, , PDF and vector files (AI, EPS, SVG). All submissions should be high-resolution (minimum 300 DPI) and include a full pattern tile. Optional: mockup showing the pattern in use.
settings.faq_3_question: How many designs can I submit?
settings.faq_4_answer:
What you win:

- Your design becomes a real product
- You get to name the print
- Your name goes on the product description, our website, emails, social media, the whole deal
- At least 3 pairs of your winning design
- A framed print of your art
- Bragging rights for life
settings.faq_5_answer: Submissions will initially be reviewed by Kyle and team to confirm they're appropriate and/or feasible to produce. Once they pass the initial inspection...then the public will have 7 days to vote!
settings.faq_6_question: Do I retain rights to my design?
settings.faq_6_answer: By submitting a design, you agree that Swoveralls can use it for a limited edition collection if selected. Your compensation includes getting to name the print, having your name featured in the product description and across your marketing (website, emails, social), and receiving free pairs of your design. Swoveralls owns the rights to produce and sell the design.
settings.faq_7_question: Can I submit designs I've created for other projects?
settings.faq_7_answer: Sure! But the designs must be original, not previously published, and currently owned by you.
settings.faq_8_answer: Sure! All tools are welcome, as long as you're adhering to all copyright/licensing laws and have the proper permissions.
settings.faq_10_question: Do I need to be a professional designer?
settings.faq_10_answer: Absolutely not. We want to see what YOU would wear, not what you think we want to see.

settings.copy:
Bachelor/ette parties, company swag, or outfits for your band... let us cover you. Literally. In buttery soft Swoveralls personalized with your design.

Fill out the form below to request your order. Once submitted, a member on our team will be in touch to finalize details.
